snippet: The Bank of England said it would keep its key interest rate at 0.5 percent, where it has been since March 2009.
abstract: Bank of England, facing continued slow growth, decides to leave its benchmark interest range unchanged at record low of 0.5 percent and bond purchasing program unchanged.
lead_paragraph: The Bank of England said it would keep its key interest rate at 0.5 percent, where it has been since March 2009.

headline.main: British Rate Still at 0.5% As Growth Stays Slow
headline.print_headline: British Rate Still at 0.5% As Growth Stays Slow
